reviews.review: Хорошая игра для подумать головой, и раскинуть мозгами, так же играть совместно с другом тоже очень и очень интересно, командный дух, все дела. Советую

You don't see a lot of times that a sequel actually [i]exceeds[/i] the original.
This is one of those times, though.

What a game. This game has everything the original Portal had, only longer, better story, more characters and everything. The puzzles are even more challenging and the gels add more variety to the game. A must have in your Steam library, casual or serious.

Only thing Portal 1 does better in than this game is the end song. Still Alive is a classic, but even then the end song is still good.
fine

Before I say anything, this game is kinda ruined for me cause of some of the fanart I've seen on some websites I will not name.  I now have a slight aversion to Aperture Laboratories.

--

This game is great as a game, and as a tech demo to show what can be  done with Valve's source engine.  The puzzles -as always, provide a challenge, and of course, the best thing about this game is Cave Johnson.

The Perpetual Testing Initiative also offers new challenges not made by the developers -but by us, the community.  However, the architecture can get a little repetitive unless you play the top rated maps which offer more intricate environments.  The PTI tests are tough, but don't require knowledge of exploits.

There is one drawback to this game, and its the story.  If you look past Wheatley, GLaDOS's witty remarks, and Cave Johnson's inspiring quotes, the story is actually very depressing.  If you are trying to avoid depression, then try not to play the story too much.

Otherwise, this is a great game, and for the best results, grab a friend to take with you into co-op.  You'll have plenty of fun with portals and gels and lasers, pretty much everything.  Except the companion cube, though.  That guy's a dick.
Portal 2 is one of the best co-op games ever made to date, If enjoy puzzle games then this is for you

Imagine a game that takes a brilliant concept and adds a brilliant writing, a brilliant history and a brilliant acting, making a brilliant game. That's Portal 2.
 
 Portal 2 is the perfect sequel to the original. It uses the same basic elements and gameplay, but adds so much more. New elements like gels, lasers, the excursion Funnel, the Hard Light Bridge and even the Edgeless Safety Cube (among many others), contribute to a fresh and new atmosphere that will never seem a simply copy from the original.

 In the solo campaign you play again as Chell, but it's not more of the same. Besides an interesting and brilliant history packed with a magnificent voice acting and challenging puzzles with unique gameplays, the writing of this game is absolutely amazing. The monologues of glados and wheatley and their jokes create a immersive and a really special atmosphere where you feel like the protagonist (despite you being a mute dangerous lunatic)

 Besides that, the game brings a extremely well executed multiplayer co-op that grabs everything that is perfect in the solo campaign and adds the perfect element: a friend. The Perpetual Testing Initiative will make you spend hours playing maps from other people or making your own puzzle.

I'll recommend Portal 2 to any creature. If you want to have fun and play an excellent game, BUY IT. One of the best games ever and maybe the best Valve game.

By now an older game, but definitely one that has aged well!

Pro's:
- Awesome Storyline
- Coop mode
- No platforming skill needed to solve the puzzles
- A great cast of characters, including Wheatley
- You really get the feeling that you're exploring Aperture Science, meaning that it feels like an open world game even though progress is linear.


Cons:
- Professor Portal Achievement, which is really difficult (and antifun) to get
- Your coop partner can be really frustrating to play with


Overall: Click 'Add to Cart'

[h1]解谜与剧情结合所产生的胜利品[/h1]

花了五个小时通关，路上也看到了大部分彩蛋。再斟酌了这么久之后，终于决定写一篇评测了。认知有限，所以可能会有不妥的地方。[b]当然或许会有部分剧透的成分，注意一下。[/b]

首先，延续了一代的风格，在玩家认识了惠特利（Wheatly）之后，游戏便开始引入“传送”的概念。在游戏中（开发者解说里也有提到），引入“传送”概念的关卡不再是一代中需要玩家等待的开门形式，而是自行按按钮解决。这样可以使得玩家更直观明白地了解“哦，原来传送门是这样运作的。”这是一大成功。

为了使玩家更好地【欣赏】沿途的风景，二代做了引擎优化，修复了一代中“跳着前进可以加速”的BUG[spoiler]这样对于一周目以上急于通关的玩家来说简直就像强迫症看到路边不齐的井盖一样[/spoiler]。

剧情方面，相对一代做了更大的提升。BOSS们与玩家之间的对话也不再枯燥乏味，甚至还有彩蛋[spoiler]比如后面惠特利想要杀死玩家的那个地方，玩家逃出陷阱后惠特利大叫“回来，快回来！”一周目的玩家大多都会头也不回[strike]地伤透惠特利的心[/strike]。我作死地返回后就遇到了个彩蛋，惠特利不知所措地茫然道：“啊…你回来了。”之后嘛也是风趣十足。[/spoiler]

解谜方面，为了让玩家不容易卡关，关卡的设计也不怎么困难，只要观察力到位的话，路上都不怎么会有障碍。[b]一代中，如果玩家卡关过久，地图会出现稍微的变化，降低难度。[/b]二代也增添了更多的光圈科技的设备，让游戏充满了更多的可变性和挑战性。
机枪塔的设定也有些许变化，[b]在一代中，只要瞄准了玩家就会一直不停地♂射，但是在二代，只有瞄准光线着实地打在了玩家身上，机枪塔才会攻击。[/b]这么说吧，二代中如果玩家和机枪塔之间隔着玻璃，而机枪塔又看到了玩家，那么机枪塔至多也就瞄着玩家而不会攻击。（一方面是为了游戏中的设定，节约子弹；另一方面则是给玩家营造一个安静的环境来思考，机枪塔的声音实在是太吵。）

在最后的BOSS关，“飞向宇宙”这个结局不得不说是一大亮点，脑洞大开。在之前的Cave Johnson录音中也有提到“为了制造可以打出传送门的墙壁而花钱买月球岩石用来磨成粉”，这也为BOSS关在月球上开传送门埋了伏笔。

而结局，雪儿（Chell）也终于[spoiler]像是[/spoiler]逃出了光圈公司，最后爱心同伴方块也拖着被烧焦的身体跟着逃了出来（不过更像是被GlaDOS扔出来的吧？），让人浮想联翩。期待着第三部的续作。

以上，就是全部评测。有许多的精良MOD也值得一试。
THA BEST GAME EVA

Portal 2 is one of my favorite games. Portal was fun, challenging, and had an amazing atmosphere, but for those like myself who found its extremely short if remarkably well-paced two-hour playtime to be somewhat disappointing, Portal 2 is my preferred out of the two.

The environments and detail make a triumphant return, along with a handful of the old test chambers early on. The atmosphere is a touch less claustrophobic and thus less personal as in Portal, but uses that extra breathing room to open up the setting. The facility feels more alive this time around, an impression only enhanced by getting to see so much more of it.

The addition of Wheatley adds variety and drive to the gameplay and story respectively. He plays off of GLaDOS nicely and has his own unique charm that I found quite endearing, even if I can't speak for his universal appeal. Cave Johnson's story arc contributes only more to the game, again adding his own flavor to the tests and environments.

Like Portal, the boss fight will provide a sense of closure to the story, but won't be the hardest puzzle in the game by a long shot. It is more complex than Portal's boss fight and can be quite creative at times, but could've been a lot stronger. As far as the test chambers themselves are concerned, the addition of co-op was a great idea provided you can find a friend, and community-made test chambers are where all the amazing innovative ideas still unexplored by the game proper are hiding.

At cost of Portal's extremely personal feel, Portal 2 expands on the world of Aperture Sciences, providing depth formerly missing, and keeping things interesting with other characters to vary up the gameplay.

Geniales Spiel, war mal auf Platz 1 in Steam gemäß Nutzerreviews, jetzt leider etwas auf Platz 3 abgerutscht. Was es natürlich nicht zu einem schlechten Spiel macht! Ganz im Gegenteil, Portal 2 bietet im Singleplayer sowie im Multiplayer Modus etliche Stunden Spielspaß, zwischendurch muss man für manche Rätsel echt seinen Kopf anstrengen, und wem das nicht reicht, der darf auch noch von der Community erstellte Testkammern spielen. Ebenfalls sowohl Einzel als auch Koop. Nebenbei hat das Spiel auch eine überaus interessante und humorvolle Story, die die aus Portal perfekt fortsetzt.
19,99€ ist das Spiel zwar durchaus wert, allerdings gibt es das so häufig für 4,99€ (Summer Sale, Winter Sale, immer mal wieder zwischendurch), dass man eigentlich die 15€ sparen kann und einfach bis zum nächsten Sale warten kann.
